description.narrative: 1. Stakeholder impact: The Project helps increase the capacity of mobile networks by rolling out over 9,000 mobile towers shared by several operators to deploy 4G and 5G, resulting in improved quality of mobile internet access for individuals and businesses across nine of China's lowest income provinces. Further, against the background of poor representation of women in senior management positions in China, the Project is expected to increase the share of senior female managers employed by the Company by developing awareness of business case for women in leadership, as well as policies and practices aimed at increasing recruitment and retention of women across all levels of the organization. 2. Inclusiveness: The Project contributes to improve the inclusiveness of the Chinese digital economy by inducing expansion of 5G networks in the least connected provinces via demonstration and replication channels. 3. Resilience: The Chinese telecom tower market is dominated by a SOE and has limited diversity of supply for mobile network operators. The Project has the potential to incrementally strengthen the resilience of the market for mobile connectivity via competitive channels.

IFC will provide up to US$99 million as senior loans to Guodong Network Communication Group Co. Ltd. (Guodong or the Company) to finance the Companys roll-out of over 9,000 towers in 9 poor provinces (each of which has GDP per capita in a range of 20 50% below the national average) within the frontier regions in China (the Project). The Project is IFCs first investment in the telecom tower sector in China. The Project will support private sector development in an SOE-dominated sector, promote inclusion and accelerate the efficient deployment of critical digital infrastructure in the poorest regions of the country. Guodong is the largest privately-owned and independent tower company in China with a nationwide network of 19,875 installed tower sites in 300 cities across 30 provinces as of June 30, 2020.
